SEC. 3. CHALLENGES TO THE LIST. An interested party can challenge the omission or inclusion of an activity on a published list. This Act applies to executive agencies including executive departments, military departments, and independent establishments, as defined in title 5 of the United States Code. An "inherently governmental function" is a function that is so closely related to the public interest that it requires performance by Federal Government employees.
